page.title: 16BITTER WINDS
page.content: The pinching wind crawls up my legs,around my arms and head,biting me with chilly teeth. Icy cold fingers touch warm skin catching peoples breath. Hands rub together pulling coats tightly around them. Sand blown into peoples eyes and shoes warning them to stay clear of the blinding beach trap. Faces with ruddy red noses and cheeks caused by the bitter wind.{C.SMITH.} The Chapel wind blows viciously. Icy wind sends shivers down little bodies huddling coldly on the beach top. Shufling sand creeps along the beach. This joyful voice,joyful to him, whistles loudly. Everybody know that he is here and doors slam shut.{C.BARRINGER.
